repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Urban Mobility Improvement
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Mobility
            Improvement Program Project for Senegal were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was substantial, Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance was also
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the challenging urban mobility needs of rapidly developing
            urban centers in Sub-Saharan Africa require the
            establishment of well-staffed and well-managed lead agency
            to coordinate the activities of multiple stakeholders,
            including the central Government. In sprawling urban centers
            experiencing rapid growth of their population and increased
            poverty, transport needs, and management of transport issues
            can be very challenging in the face of weak capacity at the
            central and local government levels and a mushrooming
            informal transport sector. Fleets of old transport vehicles
            compounded with lack of investment in the road
            infrastructure are causes of poor quality of transport
            services, congestion, increased road accidents and poor
            safety of the road users. Having a dedicated agency able to
            coordinate the needs of all the stakeholders in order to
            improve urban mobility is a critical step in the right
            direction for coordinating urban transport management, for
            policy formulation and implementation, and for consensus
            building among actors.

docna.cdata!: Senegal - Urban Mobility Improvement Program Project

display_title.display_title:
Senegal - Urban Mobility
            Improvement Program Project

repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Projet d'Amelioration de la
            Mobilite Urbaine a Dakar : evaluation environnementale

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment addresses
            the adverse environmental impacts resulting from the
            implementation of the Urban Mobility Improvement Project,
            envisaged to affect physical, biological, and social
            conditions. Soil erosion will occur, a major threat being
            the flow of rainwater, and waste disposal of both solid, and
            liquid wastes, creating water pollution. However, it is
            expected that air pollution will improve following
            construction, as a result of better traffic mobilization,
            due to the diminished road traffic in favor of an improved
            rail traffic, as well as adequate measures to accommodate
            parking lots, and improve gas quality. Prior to
            implementation, landowners, and residents should be
            identified, ensuring adequate compensation, public awareness
            campaigns should be conducted to inform on the consequences
            of project works, and, bid document be revised to ensure
            inclusion of environmental protection clauses. Mitigation
            measures to be adopted during construction, and operation of
            the project are: To diminish soil erosion, a waste
            management plan will be established, to remove, dispose, and
            treat wastes in an environmentally safe manner; Vegetation
            will be planted on slopes to prevent further erosion, and
            adequate drainage will be provided; Infiltration ditches
            will capture silt, and pollutants; Adequate equipment, and
            sound barriers will reduce noise, and dust pollution; and,
            Safety measures will be enforced.

display_title.display_title:
Senegal - Projet
            d'Amelioration de la Mobilite Urbaine a Dakar :
            evaluation environnementale (Vol. 3) : Summary - conclusions

437780.trustfund:
TF036603-SENEGAL - URBAN TRANSPORT
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF036392-SENEGAL - URBAN TRANSPORT
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF025762-PHRD-URBAN MOBILITY

repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Urban Mobility Improvement
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urban Mobility Improvement Program
            Project aims to contribute to the improvement of the safety,
            efficiency, and environmental quality of urban mobility in
            the Dakar metropolitan area, especially for the urban poor,
            and improve road safety in Thies and Kaolack. There are five
            main components. The first implements a road rehabilitation
            program and road safety and traffic management measures. The
            second component supports measures for pedestrian and
            traffic safety along the suburban railway line. The third
            component provides technical and financial support to
            develop a leasing scheme. The fourth component develops an
            urban air quality management strategy. The fifth component
            builds capacity and provides institutional support for
            Dakar's urban transport coordinating council (CETUD).

docna.cdata!: Senegal - Urban Mobility Improvement Program Project

display_title.display_title:
Senegal - Urban Mobility
            Improvement Program Project
